title: 106_s1717
content: The "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" allows optional coverage of low-income, uninsured pregnant women under a state child health plan. This amendment adds a section for the optional coverage of low-income, uninsured pregnant women to Title XXI of the Social Security Act. The "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" allows states to provide coverage for pregnancy-related assistance to targeted low-income pregnant women under a child health plan. This assistance includes prenatal, delivery, and postpartum services, as well as services for conditions that may complicate pregnancy. The "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" allows states to provide coverage for pregnancy-related assistance to targeted low-income pregnant women under a child health plan, with special rules applying to include pregnant women in references to low-income children. The "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" allows states to provide coverage for pregnancy-related assistance to low-income pregnant women, with special rules applying to include pregnant women in references to low-income children. The "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" allows states to provide coverage for pregnancy-related assistance to low-income pregnant women without any waiting period. This coverage is subject to funding restrictions outlined in section 2105(c) of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by the "Mothers and Newborns Health Insurance Act of 1999" eliminate waiting periods for targeted low-income pregnant children under title XXI of the Social Security Act. The effective date of these amendments is the enactment date of the Act. SEC. 3. Automatic enrollment for children born to women receiving pregnancy-related assistance. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows children born to low-income pregnant women receiving pregnancy-related assistance to be automatically enrolled in the State child health plan at birth until they reach 1 year of age. This amendment is effective immediately upon enactment and applies to funding under title XXI for all fiscal years. Expanded availability of funding for administrative costs related to outreach and eligibility determinations is addressed in Section 4. Section 1931(h) of the Social Security Act is amended to increase the federal matching rate for administrative costs related to outreach and eligibility determinations for children and pregnant women. This includes outreach activities and determinations of eligibility under the State plan or title XXI. Encouragement of local and community-based initiatives is also emphasized. The Secretary shall establish a procedure for local and community-based organizations to seek administrative cost reimbursement for outreach and enrollment activities for children and pregnant women under title XXI. The Secretary shall establish a procedure for organizations to seek reimbursement for outreach and enrollment activities for children and pregnant women under title XXI, including payment responsibilities.
